text.p: These are the headlines from selected Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Klein collects huge majority: Albertans tell Premier they like the way he eliminated province's C$3.4-billion deficit.
- Canadian viewers get more control: CRTC changes rules of TV game.
- Parking tickets strip up suspects: 3 held in daring jewelry robbery.
- Yeltsin moves to trim bloated cabinet: Chubais big winner as President aims for smaller, more energetic team.
- Battle for Jerusalem doesn't use bullets: Identity cards, housing are weapons in fight for contested capital.
- Albania slowly disintegrating into north-south civil clash.
- U.S. vultures pick at Eaton's: New York firms have 20-30 percent of distressed retailer's C$150-million trade debt, sources say.
- Alberta Stock Exchange shuts down as software fails again: 'I apologize profusely,' president says.
- Atlantic retailers win sales tax battle: Senate committee votes not to force tax inclusive pricing.
- Papua witch doctor to put hex on Vancouver Stock Exchange.
- Vultures close in on Eaton's debt: Bids by U.S. funds for C$160 million owing have climbed towards 90 cents on the dollar, sparking predictions two banks will sell this week.
